ygData.subject: Re: Gnomish Fireworks - Ugh!
ygData.msgSnippet: Yep I made a bunch too.  I didn t realize each one had a different fireworks number.  I thought they just shot random colors.  And yes it was a terrible let
ygData.messageBody:
Yep I made a bunch too. I didn't realize each one had a different fireworks
number. I thought they just shot random colors. And yes it was a terrible
let down. hehe that guy that posted earlier about having a tinkerer's
meeting and fireing his one and only firework would have been a pretty
pathetic finale. :) I made a bunch and was handing them out to people for
free outside ak'anon. And everyone that took one, fired it and then asked
me "How do you use it? I right clicked on it and didn't see anything".
Every single person said that. hehe I told them don't blink or you'll miss
it. lol

Althought I did make a couple collapsable fishing poles! (3 metal rods, 1
gnomish bolts) And I even made a spyglass after 3 attempts. All in all,
I'm a happy gnome for the first time in a while. :)

---
gr0k - Stranger in a Strange Land - http://www.juju.org
"Linux... find out what you've been missing while
you've been rebooting Windows NT" - Infoworld

> From: David <mymail@...>
>
> I just made a bunch of sets of gnomish fireworks...The recipe is
> Firewater (1)
> Bat Wing (1)
> Metal Shaft (1).
>
> This costs around a gold to make and produces 4 separate fireworks.
> They differ in that each one has a different effect (Fireworks1,
> Fireworks2, Fireworks3, Fireworks4). Unfortunately the effect of each
> one is horrible! They might be broken, but as of right now they do
> nothing but send a TINY colored flame straight out from your body and
> lasts about a tenth of a second at best. The difference between the 4
> types seems to be color of the flame. That is IF you even catch a
> glimpse of the flame (if you blink you will miss it). About the only
> good thing I can say about them is that Im glad they cost me next to
> nothing to make, since for now they seem to be a complete waste.
>
> I hope this was an isolated experience and that other people have more
> luck than I do with them.
